info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 8:18PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Union and Richmond Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 818 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Middlesex, or near Plainfield, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Plainfield, Linden, Huguenot, Tottenville, Clark, Union, Westfield, Rahway, Scotch Plains, Cranford, Hillside, Roselle, Roselle Park, Berkeley Heights and Kenilworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
